meanings.definition: To expose (something) again to a particular situation or condition.
meanings.sent1: After the rain stopped, the sun reexposed the colorful flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The archaeologist carefully reexposed the ancient artifacts buried beneath the sand.
meanings.sent3: The magician reexposed the hidden rabbit, much to the delight of the audience.
meanings.sent4: The detective reexposed the long-forgotten evidence, shedding new light on the case.
meanings.sent5: The artist reexposed the canvas to different lighting, revealing hidden details in the painting.

meanings.definition: To subject (someone) to something again, especially something unpleasant or harmful.
meanings.sent1: The doctor reexposed the patient to the allergen to confirm the diagnosis.
meanings.sent2: The bully reexposed the victim to his taunts, causing distress once more.
meanings.sent3: The prankster reexposed his friend to the fake spider, resulting in a comical reaction.
meanings.sent4: The survivor felt reexposed to the trauma when visiting the site of the accident.
meanings.sent5: The teacher reexposed the class to the challenging math problem, encouraging perseverance.
